com.i2group.apollo.searchservice

Interface ISearchService


  • public interface ISearchService
    A set of methods for performing searches of various kinds against the Items in the Analysis Repository or an ELP stage.
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      SearchSummary dumbbellSearch(SearchNode fromEntity, SearchNode link, SearchNode toEntity)
      Searches the Analysis Repository or an ELP stage for dumbbells that meet a range of criteria, returning a SearchSummary.
      SearchExpandResults expand(List<ItemIdentifier> seedItemIdentifiers, List<String> throughLinkTypes, List<String> toEntityTypes, int maxNumberOfLinks, boolean shouldThrowIfTooManyLinks)
      Finds and returns the Links with the specified types (together with their associated ends with the specified types), connected to the Entitys with the specified ItemIdentifiers.
      Collection<DuplicateItems> findDuplicateItems(List<ItemDiscriminator> itemDiscriminators)
      Discovers Items that may be considered duplicates because they have matching values for certain characteristic PropertyTypes.

      Finds and returns, in paged form, the Links with the specified types (together with their associated ends with the specified types), connected to the Entitys with the specified ItemIdentifiers.

      Performs a one-step search and retrieve operation, combining the functionality of search and retrieve into a single call.

    • Method Detail

      • dumbbellSearch

        SearchSummary dumbbellSearch(SearchNode fromEntity,
                             SearchNode link,
                             SearchNode toEntity)
                      throws InvalidArgumentException,
                             ValidationException,
                             StringArgumentTooLongException
        Searches the Analysis Repository or an ELP stage for dumbbells that meet a range of criteria, returning a SearchSummary. Dumbbells can be included in or excluded from the SearchSummary depending on how they match the specified SearchNodes, which must be populated following the same rules as the arguments to search.

        Items appear (or do not appear) in the SearchSummary according to the same security and prohibition rules as those for search.

        Note: If the search is unbounded, or the number of results exceeds the configured maximum, then the SearchSummary does not provide a count of the results it contains.

        Parameters:
        fromEntity - A SearchNode containing criteria that an Entity at the "from" end of a dumbbell must match.
        link - A SearchNode containing criteria that the Link in a dumbbell must match.
        toEntity - A SearchNode containing criteria that an Entity at the "to" end of a dumbbell must match.
        Returns:
        See above.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If any of the arguments are not valid.
        ValidationException - If a general validation error occurs.
        StringArgumentTooLongException - If a String in any of the arguments is too long.
        Since:
        3.0

      • search

        SearchSummary search(String searchString,
                     SetInfo setInfo,
                     ItemTypeIdList itemTypeIds,
                     FilterInfoList filterInfos)
              throws InvalidArgumentException,
                     ValidationException,
                     SetSizeExceededException,
                     StringArgumentTooLongException
        Searches the Analysis Repository or an ELP stage for Items that meet a range of criteria, returning a SearchSummary. Items can be included in or excluded from the SearchSummary depending on whether they:
        • Contain a specified String.
        • Appear in a set owned by a specified Item.
        • Have an ItemType with a specified identifier.
        • Contain Propertys or metadata with specified (ranges of) values.

        However, an Item that would otherwise appear in the SearchSummary is not included when:

        • The Item is deleted.
        • The user has an access level of SecurityAccessLevel.NONE on the Item.
        • The Item has an ItemType that has the ProhibitedRetrieve indicator.
        • The Item is a Link with an end Entity on which the user has an access level of SecurityAccessLevel.NONE.
        • The Item is a Link with an end Entity whose ItemType has the ProhibitedRetrieve indicator.
        • The user has an access level of SecurityAccessLevel.READ_CLOAKED on a set owner.
        • The user has not constrained the search by ItemType, but the Item has a type that does not support browsing.

        Otherwise, an Item is included in the SearchSummary when:

        • The Item is not deleted, and the user has an access level of SecurityAccessLevel.READ_CLOAKED (or above) on it.
        • The Item is a Link with a deleted end.
        Note: If the search is unbounded, or the number of results exceeds the configured maximum, then the SearchSummary does not provide a count of the results it contains.
        Parameters:
        searchString - A String that contains some text that matching Items must contain, or null to match all Items.
        setInfo - A SetInfo that specifies the Item that owns the set that matching Items must be in, or null to match all Items.
        itemTypeIds - An ItemTypeIdList that contains the identifiers for the ItemTypes that matching Items must have, or null to match all Items.
        filterInfos - A FilterInfoList that defines Property and metadata values that matching Items must have, or null to match all Items. This parameter must be null when itemTypeIds identifies more than one ItemType.
        Returns:
        See above, or null if the Item specified in setInfo:
        • does not own a set
        • has been deleted
        • does not exist
        • gives the current user an access level of SecurityAccessLevel.NONE
        • has an ItemType that has the ProhibitedRetrieve indicator.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If any of the arguments are not valid.
        ValidationException - If a general validation error occurs.
        SetSizeExceededException - If a set is too large to be searched.
        StringArgumentTooLongException - If a String in any of the arguments is too long.
        Since:
        2.0

      • retrieve

        SearchResults retrieve(String searchToken,
                       DumbbellPart dumbbellPart,
                       ItemTypeIdList itemTypeIds,
                       FilterInfoList filterInfos,
                       SortInfo sortInfo,
                       int maxResultCount,
                       PageInfo pageInfo)
                throws InvalidArgumentException,
                       ValidationException,
                       StringArgumentTooLongException
        Retrieves SearchResults created by a previous call to search or dumbbellSearch, allowing sorting and additional filtering to be carried out. Sorting and filtering depend on whether Items:
        • Have an ItemType with a specified identifier.
        • Contain Propertys with specified (ranges of) values.
        • Occupy a particular position within a dumbbell.
        See the search documentation for the rules that govern whether an Item appears in the SearchResults at all. The following rules then determine how it appears.

        An Item is returned as an ItemPlaceholder when:

        • The user has an access level of SecurityAccessLevel.READ_CLOAKED on the Item.
        • The Item is a deleted end Entity of a Link that has been returned.

        An Item is returned as an Item when:

        • The Item is not deleted, and the user has an access level of SecurityAccessLevel.READ_ONLY (or above) on the Item.

        When retrieving results from a dumbbellSearch, the following additional rules apply to dumbbells with deleted parts:

        • If DumbbellPart.ALL was specified, then dumbbells with deleted parts are included in the SearchResults, subject to these conditions:
          • Deleted ends are included only if there are no additional constraints (that is, no search term, filters, or item types are applied).
          • Deleted links are never returned.
        • If DumbbellPart.FROM, DumbbellPart.LINK, or DumbbellPart.TO was specified, then dumbbells with deleted parts are not included in the SearchResults.

        The returned SearchResults only contain highlighting information in the CardInfos if the call to search or dumbbellSearch included a search string (or filterInfos that use strings). In the case of dumbbellSearch, highlighting information is only included if DumbbellPart.ALL was specified.

        Parameters:
        searchToken - A String that identifies the results to retrieve.
        dumbbellPart - A DumbbellPart indicating the location in dumbbells that matching Items must occupy. When retrieving results from a search, this must be set to DumbbellPart.NONE. When retrieving results from a dumbbellSearch, this can be set to DumbbellPart.FROM, DumbbellPart.LINK, DumbbellPart.TO, or DumbbellPart.ALL.
        itemTypeIds - An ItemTypeIdList containing identifiers for the ItemTypes that matching Items must have, or null to match all Items. The ItemTypeIdList specified must be a subset of the ItemTypeIdList used in the preceding search operation. This parameter must be null when dumbbellPart is set to DumbbellPart.ALL.
        filterInfos - A FilterInfoList defining Property and metadata values that matching Items must have, or null to match all Items. This FilterInfoList is additional to the one specified in the preceding call to search or dumbbellSearch. This parameter must be null when itemTypeIds identifies more than one ItemType, or when dumbbellPart is set to DumbbellPart.ALL.
        sortInfo - A SortInfo determining how the retrieved Items are to be ordered.
        maxResultCount - The maximum number of Items to return to the client, which must not be negative.
        pageInfo - A PageInfo indicating which page of results to retrieve.
        Returns:
        See above, or null if the original search was constrained using an Item that owned a set but now:
        • does not own a set
        • has been deleted
        • does not exist
        • gives the current user an access level of SecurityAccessLevel.NONE
        • has an ItemType that has the ProhibitedRetrieve indicator.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If any of the arguments are not valid.
        ValidationException - If a general validation error occurs.
        StringArgumentTooLongException - If a String in any of the arguments is too long.
        Since:
        2.0

      • searchAndRetrieve

        SearchResults searchAndRetrieve(String searchString,
                                SetInfo setInfo,
                                ItemTypeIdList itemTypeIds,
                                FilterInfoList filterInfos,
                                SortInfo sortInfo,
                                int maxResultCount,
                                PageInfo pageInfo)
                         throws InvalidArgumentException,
                                ValidationException,
                                SetSizeExceededException,
                                StringArgumentTooLongException
        Performs a one-step search and retrieve operation, combining the functionality of search and retrieve into a single call.

        See the search and retrieve documentation for the rules that govern whether and how an Item appears in the SearchResults.

        Parameters:
        searchString - A String containing some text that matching Items must contain, or null to match all Items.
        setInfo - A SetInfo that specifies the Item that owns the set that matching Items must be in, or null to match all Items.
        itemTypeIds - An ItemTypeIdList containing the identifiers for the ItemTypes that matching Items must have, or null to match all Items.
        filterInfos - A FilterInfoList defining Property and metadata values that matching Items must have, or null to match all Items. This parameter must be null when itemTypeIds identifies more than one ItemType.
        sortInfo - A SortInfo determining how the retrieved Items are to be ordered.
        maxResultCount - The maximum number of Items to return to the client, which must not be negative.
        pageInfo - A PageInfo indicating which page of results to retrieve.
        Returns:
        See above, or null if the Item specified in setInfo:
        • does not own a set
        • has been deleted
        • does not exist
        • gives the current user an access level of SecurityAccessLevel.NONE
        • has an ItemType that has the ProhibitedRetrieve indicator.
        The returned ItemSearchResults only contain highlighting information in their CardInfos if the call included a searchString (or filterInfos that use Strings).
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If any of the arguments are not valid.
        ValidationException - If a general validation error occurs.
        SetSizeExceededException - If a set is too large to be searched.
        StringArgumentTooLongException - If a String in any of the arguments is too long.
        Since:
        2.0

      • findDuplicateItems

        Collection<DuplicateItems> findDuplicateItems(List<ItemDiscriminator> itemDiscriminators)
                                       throws InvalidArgumentException,
                                              ValidationException
        Discovers Items that may be considered duplicates because they have matching values for certain characteristic PropertyTypes.

        More precisely, an Item will be identified as a duplicate if the values of its Propertys are exactly equal to the values in one of the specified ItemDiscriminators.

        Parameters:
        itemDiscriminators - The ItemDiscriminators to compare Items against.
        Returns:
        DuplicateItems containing an entry for each ItemDiscriminator that matched one or more Items.

        ItemDiscriminators can only match Items for which the current user has a SecurityAccessLevel of SecurityAccessLevel.READ_ONLY or above.

        If a particular ItemDiscriminator does not match any Items, there is no corresponding entry.

        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If any of the arguments are not valid.
        ValidationException - If a general validation error occurs.
        Since:
        2.0

      • expand

        SearchExpandResults expand(List<ItemIdentifier> seedItemIdentifiers,
                           List<String> throughLinkTypes,
                           List<String> toEntityTypes,
                           int maxNumberOfLinks,
                           boolean shouldThrowIfTooManyLinks)
                    throws InvalidArgumentException,
                           TooManyItemsException,
                           TooManySeedsException,
                           ValidationException
        Finds and returns the Links with the specified types (together with their associated ends with the specified types), connected to the Entitys with the specified ItemIdentifiers.

        Any of the Entitys specified in itemIdentifiers that are not connected to a Link are not returned.

        Where present, all the Links are returned for each of the specified Entitys. If both ends of a Link are specified, then the Link is returned twice (once for each end).

        A Link is only returned if it meets the security and prohibition rules for it to appear in the SearchSummary after a call to search.

        Parameters:
        seedItemIdentifiers - The ItemIdentifiers of the Entitys connected to the Links to be retrieved.
        throughLinkTypes - Strings containing the identifiers of the LinkTypes of the Links to be retrieved. If this parameter is null or empty, the expand is not constrained by the Link type.
        toEntityTypes - Strings containing the identifiers of the EntityTypes of the Entitys at the other end of the Links to be retrieved. If this parameter is null or empty, the expand is not constrained by the end Entity type.
        maxNumberOfLinks - The maximum number of Links to be returned.
        shouldThrowIfTooManyLinks - true to throw an exception (and return no results) when the number of Links connected to the identified Entitys exceeds maxNumberOfLinks; false to throw no exception and return up to maxNumberOfLinks results. If maxNumberOfLinks is not exceeded, this parameter has no effect.
        Returns:
        A SearchExpandResults containing the Links connected to the identified Entitys. If maxNumberOfLinks is exceeded, the order and contents of the results are not defined.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If any of the arguments are not valid.
        TooManyItemsException - If more items will be returned than the limit in maxNumberOfLinks.
        TooManySeedsException - If the number of ItemIdentifiers in seedItemIdentifiers is higher than the server-imposed limit.
        ValidationException - If a general validation error occurs.
        Since:
        3.0

      • pagedExpand

        PagedExpandResults pagedExpand(List<ItemIdentifier> seedItemIdentifiers,
                               List<String> throughLinkTypes,
                               List<String> toEntityTypes,
                               int maxNumberOfLinksPerPage,
                               String pageToken)
                        throws InvalidArgumentException,
                               TooManySeedsException,
                               ValidationException
        Finds and returns, in paged form, the Links with the specified types (together with their associated ends with the specified types), connected to the Entitys with the specified ItemIdentifiers.

        Any of the Entitys specified in itemIdentifiers that are not connected to a Link are not returned.

        Where present, all the Links are returned for each of the specified Entitys. If both ends of a Link are specified, then the Link is returned twice (once for each end).

        A Link is only returned if it meets the security and prohibition rules for it to appear in the SearchSummary after a call to search.

        Note: This method supports paging in a different way from the retrieve and searchAndRetrieve methods. Paging here is forward-only, so the controlling parameter uses a simple String token instead of a PageInfo object.

        Parameters:
        seedItemIdentifiers - The ItemIdentifiers of the Entitys connected to the Links to be retrieved. If pageToken is not null, this parameter value must be the same as when the method was called with a null pageToken.
        throughLinkTypes - Strings containing the identifiers of the LinkTypes of the Links to be retrieved. If this parameter is null or empty, the expand is not constrained by Link type. If pageToken is not null, this parameter value must be the same as when the method was called with a null pageToken.
        toEntityTypes - Strings containing the identifiers of the EntityTypes of the Entitys at the other end of the Links to be retrieved. If this parameter is null or empty, the expand is not constrained by the end Entity type. If pageToken is not null, this parameter value must be the same as when the method was called with a null pageToken.
        maxNumberOfLinksPerPage - The maximum number of Links to be returned in a page of results.
        pageToken - A String containing the page token returned from a previous call to this method, or null to retrieve the first page of results.
        Returns:
        A PagedExpandResults containing the Links connected to the identified Entitys and the PageResultInfo with the page token to be used for retrieving the next page in a subsequent call.
        Throws:
        InvalidArgumentException - If any of the arguments are not valid.
        TooManySeedsException - If the number of ItemIdentifiers in seedItemIdentifiers is higher than the server-imposed limit.
        ValidationException - If a general validation error occurs.
        Since:
        3.0
